motions.title: Consent Agenda Approval as Amended
motions.description: Approval of consent agenda with removal of item #14 (Funding Authorization for Nature Center Eco Classroom Storm Improvements) including: • Approval of May 22, 2023, City Council Meeting Minutes • Resolution Requesting that DeKalb County Voter Registration & Elections Conduct the City of Dunwoody General Election on November 7, 2023 • Resolution Appointing Members to Serve on the Dunwoody Alcohol License Review Board • Resolution Appointing Members to Serve on the Dunwoody Board of Zoning Appeals • Resolution Appointing Members to Serve on the Sustainability Committee • SECOND READ Review and Consideration of Text Amendments to the Code for Chapter 27 Article V, to reflect changes to the state Zoning Procedures Law • SECOND READ Review and Consideration of Text Amendments to the Code for Chapter 8, Article IV, to reflect changes to the water efficiency regulations • Vietnam War Memorial Donation • Drive Lane Paving for Two Bridges Park

motions.title: Funding Authorization for Nature Center Eco Classroom Storm Improvements
motions.description: Approval of funding authorization for Dunwoody Nature Center eco classroom storm improvements in amount of $790,000 plus 5% contingency, for total of $830,000.

motions.title: SLUP 23-02: Special Land Use Permit for 5342 Tilly Mill Road (Second Read)
motions.description: Second read approval of Special Land Use Permit for 5342 Tilly Mill Road to allow an existing neighborhood recreation club and for construction of new sport courts with new condition #3 added.

motions.title: Text Amendment for Commercial Vehicle Parking Regulations (Second Read)
motions.description: Second read approval of text amendments to Chapter 27, Article III, Division 3, to update commercial vehicle parking regulations for home occupations.

motions.title: Text Amendment for Nonconforming Uses Requirements (Second Read)
motions.description: Second read approval of text amendments to Chapter 27, Article VI, Division 4, to update the requirements for nonconforming uses, removing overly broad exemptions.

motions.title: Park Naming for Roberts Drive Park Property
motions.description: Motion to name the Roberts Drive park Wildcat Park.

motions.title: Authorization to Enter Agreement with Central Square
motions.description: Approval of authorization to enter into agreement with Central Square for Community Development Application contingent upon purchasing manager checking company references.

motions.title: Amending City Position Allocation and Compensation Chart
motions.description: Approval of amendment to city position allocation and compensation chart.

publicHearings.title: Public Hearing for Establishing 2023 Millage Rate
publicHearings.description: Second of three required public hearings for proposed 2023 millage rate of 3.040 mills, same as 2022. One speaker opposed (Bob Hickey requesting rollback to 2.70 mills), one speaker opposed (Sandy, citing 54.6% tax increase). Third public hearing to be held July 10, 2023.
publicHearings.recommendation: Staff recommends adoption at July 10th meeting

publicHearings.title: RZ 23-01 & SLUP 23-01: 4470 Chamblee Dunwoody Road Rezoning (First Read)
publicHearings.description: First read of request to rezone 4470 Chamblee Dunwoody Road from O-I to O-D with Special Land Use Permit to increase maximum allowed height to 4-stories for four-story self-storage facility. Planning Commission recommended approval.

publicHearings.title: RZ 23-02 & SLUP 23-03: Modification to Remove Condition #25 (First Read)
publicHearings.description: First read of modification of zoning and SLUP conditions for cases RZ 20-03 & SLUP 20-02 to remove condition of approval #25. Planning Commission unanimously recommended approval.
publicHearings.recommendation: Staff recommends striking condition on timeline

discussionItems.title: Concept Design for Peeler Road Path
discussionItems.description: Presentation of concept design for first phase of Peeler Road path between Winters Chapel Road and Windwood Hollow Park with next steps for staff to meet with neighbors.

notes: Council Member Harris recused herself from SLUP 23-02 discussion and voting due to employment at Marcus Jewish Community Center of Atlanta
